content.description: Short climb along a crack with a good deep pocket jug halfway upThere has been some controversy over the rating and bolting of this climb. It has been said that a grade of 5.12 is too high- that's fair. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion, and your mileage may vary.It has also been said that this climb should only have been a boulder problem and should never have been bolted. Well, as with all the climbs in this area, significant effort (e.g. brushing, de-flaking, and even removal of a tree sapling growing from the juggy pocket) was required to develop this route. All of this was done on top rope, so this route would not be the climb it is today by bouldering alone.If you choose to try it as a boulder problem, use a pad and spotter, and be confident!  Have a plan for getting home safely in the event of an injury (e.g. a good crew, first aid supplies, etc).
Roof start.  The crux is getting onto the face.  Easy middle section, then another hard move on thin holds for the topout
content.protection: 4 bolts, ring and quicklink for top anchors
content.location: Far right side of hog wall, before the powdery drop off

content.description: Slab start with a bulgey high heel topout
content.protection: 3 bolts, two bolts for top anchors (no permanent hardware- clean from top)

content.description: Slabby start on thin feet and crimps with a crimpy finish.  Follow the bolt line for a harder topout or traverse left for an easier way
content.protection: 3 bolts, two bolts for top anchors (no permanent hardware- clean from top)

content.description: Slab start with a bulgey, juggy topout
content.protection: 3 bolts, two bolts for top anchors (no permanent hardware- clean from top)

content.description: Starts with a low juggy pocket, then nothing but thin flakey crimps and jibs til the top
content.protection: 3 bolts, two bolts for top anchors (no permanent hardware- clean from top)

pathTokens: Carrion Wall and Indian Head area

content.description: Section of wall to the left of Indian Head/ Carrion Wall. Climbs are very short and the rock is pretty flakey, but it's good slabby starts with challenging topouts.Most climbs here have two bolts at the top without lower off rings/ hooks, so equipment to build a top anchor (e.g. a quad, webbing, opposing draws etc.) Is required.  Clean from the top for each climb.Climbs get progressively harder from right to left
